definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Our country has a long history, culture, source of long, countless art since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 我国历史悠久，文化源长，自古至今书画家不计其数。

sentences.english: In the history of Chinese art, Huang Shen, a highly successful calligraphers and painters.
sentences.chinese: 在中国美术史上，黄慎是一位卓有成就的书画家。

sentences.english: There are the authorizations by the artists' autography for all the phone cards which are authentic.
sentences.chinese: 均有书画家先生亲笔授权书，枚枚为真。

sentences.english: It turned into sign of calligraphers and painters after the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐代以后文人画的兴盛又使之为书画家个人字号所用。

definition: Huang Binhong (1865-1955), art historian and literati painter
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
